ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
ygData.msgSnippet: I had the same problem with my Laptop. I m gonna check if i can find the site address where i found the solution to this problem.
ygData.messageBody:
I had the same problem with my Laptop. I'm gonna check if i can find the
site address where i found the solution to this problem.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nygaardr, FC3 [SMTP:nygaardr@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 28, 2001 11:27 PM
> To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
>
> Yes, I think you are right. ATI 3d card. How did you know?
>
> Mu
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: LAINE. Mikael (Nol) [mailto:laine@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 28, 2001 3:31 AM
> To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
>
>
> This is cause your textures doesnt load right. You got a ATI mobil 3d card
> in that laptop?
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Nygaardr, FC3 [SMTP:nygaardr@...]
> > Sent: Friday, May 25, 2001 9:35 PM
> > To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
> > Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
> >
> > Thanks.  I am actually looking for name brands too.  I dont want to do
> the
> > big purchase only to find out my Video card blows and the drivers for it
> > dont work with eq that well ect ect.  I play on a 350 PII lap top with
> > 128megram and 8mb video card now.  But it has a lot of driver problems (
> I
> > see Enchanter pets!! Btw they look like humans) Nobody has the right
> shoes
> > on (everyone has really funky tie dyed shoes) I wont list all my
> problems
> > here.  But if anyone out there has a system they think is perfect for EQ
> > let me know what you have.  Thanks again
> >  
> > Mu
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: The Mad Macinchaote [mailto:scendera@...]
> > Sent: Friday, May 25, 2001 11:01 AM
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
> >
> >
> > A good video card and lots of ram should be your biggest concerns.
> > CPU speed doesn't matter nearly as much as ram seems to. I've played EQ
> on
> > 2 450's before...almost identical, but one with 128 megs ram, the other
> > with 256. Zones loaded much faster on the one with the extra ram, and
> the
> > lag on 56k modems seems minimized. A good video card should help with
> the
> > lag too.
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Nygaardr, FC3 <mailto:nygaardr@...>
> > To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
> > <mailto:'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'>
> > Sent: Friday, May 25, 2001 12:29 PM
> > Subject: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
> >
> > I will be buying a computer in a few months and am wondering
> > what some of
> > you people use to play EQ.  Going to spend a good bit so
> > anyone have any
> > suggestions for GREAT eq computer (that's about all I do
> > with the computer
> > play EQ, Web and MP3's).  Anyone have any ideas?
> >
> > Mu
